results.p: The meaning of MALIGNED is spoken about in an injurious way : harshly or unfairly criticized. How to use maligned in a sentence.

results.t: MALIGNED | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: to say false and unpleasant things about someone, or to criticize someone unfairly. She has recently been maligned in the gossip columns of several newspapers.
maligning · defamatory · disgraceful · heinous · outrageous · scurrilous · shameful · shocking · slanderous · unseemly · untrue. Weak matches. atrocious ...
adjective. spoken ill of; defamed or slandered: I pointed to my unweeded yard full of bees and waxed rhapsodic about the benefits of the maligned dandelion.

results.t: MALIGN | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: to say false and unpleasant things about someone, or to criticize someone unfairly. She has recently been maligned in the gossip columns of several newspapers.
verb (used with object). to speak harmful untruths about; speak evil of; slander; defame: to malign an honorable man.

results.t: MALIGN definition and meaning | Collins English Dictionary
results.p: 1. verb If you malign someone, you say unpleasant and untrue things about them. [formal] We maligned him dreadfully when you come to think of it.
